lead_section.paragraph: The Bengal tiger is a population of the Panthera tigris tigris subspecies and the nominate tiger subspecies. It ranks among the biggest wild cats alive today. It is considered to belong to the world's charismatic megafauna.
lead_section.what_to_notice: Starts with definition, mentions scientific name, ends with significance

lead_section.paragraph: The lion is a large cat of the genus Panthera native to Africa and India. It has a muscular, broad-chested body, short, rounded head, round ears, and a hairy tuft at the end of its tail.
lead_section.what_to_notice: Combines taxonomy with key physical features

lead_section.paragraph: The snow leopard, also known as the ounce, is a felid in the genus Panthera native to the mountain ranges of Central Asia. It is listed as Vulnerable on the IUCN Red List.
lead_section.what_to_notice: Includes alternative name, habitat, and conservation status

characteristics.paragraph: The Bengal tiger's coat is yellow to light orange, with stripes ranging from dark brown to black; the belly and the interior parts of the limbs are white, and the tail is orange with black rings.
characteristics.what_to_notice: Specific color descriptions with anatomical details

characteristics.paragraph: The lion is a muscular, broad-chested cat with a short, rounded head, a reduced neck and round ears. Its fur varies in colour from light buff to silvery grey, yellowish red and dark brown.

distribution_habitat.paragraph: Bengal tigers live in many types of forests, including wet, evergreen, and semi-evergreen forests of Assam and eastern Bengal; the swampy mangrove forest of the Ganges Delta; and the deciduous forests of Nepal.
distribution_habitat.what_to_notice: Lists multiple habitat types with specific geographic locations

distribution_habitat.paragraph: The snow leopard inhabits alpine and subalpine zones at elevations of 3,000 to 4,500 m, occasionally ranging to 5,500 m in summer. It prefers steep cliffs, rocky outcrops and ravines.
distribution_habitat.what_to_notice: Includes elevation ranges and terrain preferences

ecology_behaviour.paragraph: Tigers are mostly solitary, apart from associations between mother and offspring. Each tiger maintains a home range where it can meet its needs. Adult females establish ranges that provide sufficient prey.

The lion is a social species, forming groups called prides. A pride consists of a few adult males, related females, and cubs. Groups of female lions usually hunt together, preying mostly on large ungulates.

lead_section.title: Opening paragraph
lead_section.content: The Siberian tiger is a subspecies of tiger native to the Russian Far East and Northeast Asia. It is known for its large size and thick winter coat adapted to harsh climates.

lead_section.title: Conservation status
lead_section.content: The species is classified as Endangered by the IUCN, with an estimated population of approximately 500-600 individuals in the wild as of 2022.

lead_section.title: Scientific classification
lead_section.content: The scientific name is Panthera tigris altaica, first described by Temminck in 1844. It belongs to the Felidae family within the order Carnivora.

characteristics.title: Physical appearance
characteristics.content: The Siberian tiger has a reddish-rusty or rusty-yellow coat with narrow black transverse stripes. It has an extended supple body standing on rather short legs with a fairly long tail.

characteristics.title: Size and weight
characteristics.content: Males typically weigh between 180-306 kg with an average of 215 kg, while females weigh between 100-167 kg with an average of 137 kg. The body length ranges from 150-200 cm not including the tail.

characteristics.title: Seasonal adaptations
characteristics.content: Their winter coat is thicker and paler than their summer coat, with fur on the back reaching 40-50 mm in winter compared to 15-17 mm in summer.

distribution_habitat.title: Current range
distribution_habitat.content: Siberian tigers inhabit temperate forests in the Russian Far East, primarily in the Primorsky and Khabarovsk territories. Their habitat includes coniferous, deciduous, and mixed forests.

distribution_habitat.title: Historical distribution
distribution_habitat.content: Historically, Siberian tigers ranged across much of eastern Russia, northeastern China, and the Korean Peninsula. Their range has significantly contracted due to habitat loss and hunting.

ecology_behaviour.title: Territorial behavior
ecology_behaviour.content: Siberian tigers are solitary and territorial animals. A tiger's territory can range from 500-1000 square kilometers depending on prey availability.

ecology_behaviour.title: Hunting and diet
ecology_behaviour.content: They primarily hunt large ungulates including deer, wild boar, and elk. Tigers are most active during dawn and dusk hours when their prey is most vulnerable.
